body_html:
Depending how the required dependencies were installed Pip may be associated with a different Python installation that TensorFlow is trying to find e.g. TF may be looking into /Library/Python/2.7/site-packages/ but the Pip used was associated to /usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages (the default that comes with macOS).

I exported PYTHONPATH to reflect the corresponding Python packages location, in my case, by adding the correct site-packages path as:
export PYTHONPATH=$PYTHONPATH:/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages
body_text:
Depending how the required dependencies were installed Pip may be associated with a different Python installation that TensorFlow is trying to find e.g. TF may be looking into /Library/Python/2.7/site-packages/ but the Pip used was associated to /usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages (the default that comes with macOS).
I exported PYTHONPATH to reflect the corresponding Python packages location, in my case, by adding the correct site-packages path as:
export PYTHONPATH=$PYTHONPATH:/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages
body:
Depending how the required dependencies were installed Pip may be associated with a different Python installation that TensorFlow is trying to find e.g. TF may be looking into `/Library/Python/2.7/site-packages/` but the Pip used was associated to `/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages` (the default that comes with macOS).

I exported `PYTHONPATH` to reflect the corresponding Python packages location, in my case, by adding the correct `site-packages` path as:
`export PYTHONPATH=$PYTHONPATH:/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages`
